a month-long halt to cocoa and coffee exports. As Nigeria called on the U.N. Security Council to authorize force to prize Laurent Gbagbo out of the presidency, Alassane Ouattara 's government flexed its muscles by ordering the immediate stoppage of all exports of coffee and cocoa. The ban would last until Feb. 23, said a statement signed by Alassane Ouattara 's prime minister, Guillaume Soro, warning traders who violated it would be considered to be`` financing the illegitimate regime''
